title: Noam Chomsky -1995-03-11 - Speaking on Colombia with Juan Pablo Ordonez - MIT - Improved Audio
description:
Be sure to pick at least 720p for best sound/video quality.
On March 11, 1995, Noam Chomsky spoke along with Juan Pablo Ordonez (a Colombian human rights lawyer) about Colombia and the US role in the ongoing tragedy in that nation.  Questions and answers with Ordonez and Chomsky follows Noam's talk.


I gave the sound the best restoration I could.  Eliminated a hiss/hum/grinding sound that ran throughout.  However, starting about 38 minutes in, the sound suffers from clipping, possibly inherent in the original tape.  Alas, the video is suffers from generational loss, and is a medicore 360p.  Still it's better than nothing.


Alas, the only surviving video copies, it seems, of this event eliminate Juan Pablo Ordonez's talk, which came before Chomsky's.   For the full version of this event, in audio only, listen here:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0pViVgzGAN8

 

Thanks to Mona Ringel @monaringel255 for the upload of part 1:


 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DrLsSwZbIsI

and to Danielle Whitis @daniellewhitis1732 for part 2:



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KxE4XKj4Vuk
